messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1077
messages.msgSnippet: when I first started with the tea ds wasn t into it, either, but I told him it was like medicine. It was feel better tea. Like vitamins. He didn t really
messages.messageBody:
when I first started with the tea ds wasn't into it,
either, but I told him it was like medicine. It was
"feel better" tea. Like vitamins. He didn't really
like it, I don't think, or maybe he was just being
contrary, who knows, but I just told him it wasn't an
option. It was like taking a spoonful of yucky
medicine, only it was taking 6 sips of tea.... then a
little bit later 6 more sips...then I really got into
this honey kick (honey garlic and onions...I'm very
into them)...and started telling him there was alot of
honey in the bottom...so he would take bigger "sips"
to get there. Sometimes, he would take 6 and then I
woudl take 6 (very little ones for me...leaves more
for him) and now he just drinks it. Loves it. Dd (3)
doesn't like anything near her mouth that is warm (a
bit of a burn-fear freak that way) and so I started
her with making up double strength hot tea and putting
some honey and ice in her sippy cup thing and then
pouring the tea over them and shaking it up til the
ice melted and it was a nice room temperature drink
that was sweet and she gobbled it down like juice.
Also you could make iced tea or sun tea (some non
caffenated one) and just add a couple sleepytime bags
in with the mix, serve it with dinner. Just a few
suggestions.
-Bobbie

> dollars

> Hope that helps a little.
> -Bobbie >>

> Thank you for all the info. DD also gets more
> wound when people notice. I
> tried the bars about a yr. and a half ago but she
> didn't go for them. Bummer.
> I wish she would drink tea. I'd for sure give her
> sleepy time at about 7 pm.
>
> NICKI~

messages.subject: RE: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1077
messages.msgSnippet: Oh, I don t know how you could move from a farm home to a condo!  And believe it or not, I love the chores.  They get me out of the house into the fresh air
messages.messageBody:
Oh, I don't know how you could move from a farm home to a condo!  And believe it or not, I love the chores.  They get me out of the house into the fresh air bright and early in the morning.  (OK, OK, when it is 30 below and the wind is blowing 50 miles an hour, I whine all the way to the barn)  But overall, the plusses outway the minuses.
Angela
Unschooling mother in Maine to two beautiful daughters.
"Play is our brain's favorite way to learn."
Unknown
Check out my themestream articles.
www.themestream.com/gspd_browse/author/view_author_info.gsp?auth_id=152256
Angela's Home School
www.geocities.com/autonomousangela
-----    I love the smell of grasses. Ialso grew up w/ horses and the manure smell
never bothers me. We are moving from a ranch, w/ 4 horses and a mule, to a
condo this week and I will miss my smelly clothes. But I won't miss
caretaking one bit! :o)

    NICKI~

<< The ingredients are:
chamomila coffee belladonna and sugar.
they dissolve on the tongue and taste ...like sugar.
I get them at wal-mart or any pharmacy open...you have
to ask for them at the counter. It's about 3-5 dollars
for a bottle of 135 pellets.
Hope that helps a little.
-Bobbie >>


Thank you for all the info. DD also gets more wound when people notice. I
tried the bars about a yr. and a half ago but she didn't go for them. Bummer.
I wish she would drink tea. I'd for sure give her sleepy time at about 7 pm.

NICKI~
